datasetVersion.disclaimer: Geographic files adapted from Statistics Canada, Census Subdivisions Cartographic Boundary File, 2001 Census, Second Edition, 2002. This does not constitute an endorsement by Statistics Canada of this product.

fields.value: CCRI 1951 Census of Canada: Aggregate data and geography = CCRI 1951 Recensement du Canada: Données agrégées et cadre géographique

dsDescriptionValue.value: This study includes two components of the research infrastructure developed by CCRI for the 1951 Census of Canada: selected digitized published tables of aggregate data and a reconstruction of the census geography.

value: See also the CCRI Census of Canada materials for 1911, 1921, 1931 and 1941.

Marc St-Hilaire , Byron Moldofsky , Laurent Richard & Mariange Beaudry (2007): Geocoding and Mapping Historical Census Data: The Geographical Component of the Canadian Century Research Infrastructure, Historical Methods: A Journal of Quantitative and Interdisciplinary History, 40:2, 76-91. http://dx.doi.org/10.3200/HMTS.40.2.76-91

files.description: Table: 1951, Vol. 1, Table 34. Title: Population by origin and sex, for counties and census divisions, 1951. Source: Canada. Dominion Bureau of Statistics. 1951. Ninth Census of Canada. Ottawa: King's Printer, Vol. 1, Table 34, pp. 34-1 to 34-22. Basic unit of Geography: Census district (CD).
files.label: ccri_pub_1951_v1t34.xls

files.description: Boundary polygon files in ESRI "shape file" format that reconstruct the census compilation and dissemination geography for the 1951 at the Census division (CD) level of geography. A NAP metadata record in .xml format is included.
files.label: CCRI_Shapefiles_CD_1951.zip
